content: would like your front straps to start on the front of your top for the sample size i placed my stitch markers 14 row in on each side of the top step 15 straps join your yarn into the stitch marker on the left right side of top facing up and create a chain that is long enough to fit over your shoulders and join to the top of the last stitch on the end of the left side of the panel see pictures below slip_stitch your chain to join and slip_stitch into the stitch that sits to the left chain 1 turn your work so the chain you created is now facing you and place 1 single_crochet into each chain across until you meet the stitch marker once you meet the stitch marker place a sl st into that stitch to join the strap and cut and tie of your yarn do the same to the other strap until you have 2 identical for the sample size i created a chain of 48 for each strap step 16 setup for shell edging mark the top/middle of your straps with a stitch marker see picture below for the sample size i marked mine 24 stitches up step 17 shell edging when working your stitches into the side of the scalloped lace edging and the front section of the top between front straps you will be placing your stitches into the sides of the previous stitches rather than on top you need to place stitches into any available spaces you find a good rule is to place 2 single_crochet into each side half_double_crochet and double_crochet and 1 single_crochet into each side single_crochet join your yarn right side facing up to the bottom left corner of your top side of the scalloped lace stitch chain 1 and place 1 single_crochet into the 1st stitch *skip 2 and place 3 double_crochet chain 1 3 double_crochet into the next stitch skip 2 1 single_crochet* repeat ** this pattern into each stitch across the side of your top until you meet the stitch marker once you meet the stitch marker place 1 single_crochet into that stitch *skip 2 shell skip 2 1 single_crochet* repeat ** across for the rest of the strap across the front of the top and up the other strap until the other stitch marker once you reach the other stitch marker place 1 single_crochet into that stitch and repeat ** until the end of the other side of the top place 1 single_crochet into the last stitch and cut and tie off your yarn see all pictures below and on the next page step 18 back strap create a chain that is long enough to go in and out of every 2nd shell on each side of the back of your top once completed starting from the middle of your straps where the stitch markers were placed thread that chain in and out of the chain 1 spaces between the shells
